turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Anne...!  I know... I know that to love you is treason against France. But not to love you... is treason against my heart.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Then we will both die traitors, d'Artagnan.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: My Queen...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: D'Artagnan.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I have never seen a sight more beautiful than you, tonight.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: We have much to discuss.  Tomorrow.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: There were two.  Not one.  But two.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I couldn't tell you.  You had enough to carry.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Anne... The night we had together... I always wanted more.  But that one, it was enough.  Enough to make me love you forever.  I want you to remember that... and go on.  As strong as you are now.  No matter what happens.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Mother -- ?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: May I speak with you?  Alone?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I am preparing for a ball!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: We haven't visited in three years. And we should have privacy.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What is it, mother?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I wish to discuss your brother.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: He is dead!  By God's choice!  There is nothing to discuss.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: First they told me he had died at birth.  Then your father admitted he was alive, but well cared for, in secret.  But the message that told of his death said he had been a prisoner.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I am King, Mother!  And I do not wish to discuss this with you.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: He was my blood -- and I demand to know what happened to him.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Why would you ask now?  You never asked before!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Because I have dreamed of him.  Not as the baby they took away, but as a man.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You have prayed too much.  Your mind is weak.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It -- it doesn't matter, Mother!  He is dead now!  Dead!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Yes.  Dead.  Two nights ago.  The night of my dream.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Louis, please -- !

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: My guards are useless!  Take her from me!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What had you to do with this, Mother?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: He is your brother!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: He is nothing now.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: D'Artagnan, you will hunt down Aramis, Porthos and Athos, and bring me their heads, or I will have yours.  And as for you, Phillippe... Back to the prison you shall go, and into the mask you hate.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: No, Louis!  No!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Wear it until you love it.  And die in it!!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Your birthday celebration, your Majesty?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Next week.  This is a mere garden party -- and I wish to join it, so I will be brief.  I am experiencing resistance from the Jesuits.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Well... perhaps you should speak with them, your Majesty.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I have demanded it -- and common priests present themselves!  Can you imagine the arrogance?  Common Jesuit priests try to act as my equals, and they refuse to reveal the names of anyone else in their order!  No one can keep secrets like the Jesuits can, and the identity of their leader is the darkest secret they hold.  Even the Pope himself does not know who leads the Jesuit Order in France!  He suspects the Governor General of Jesuits, whoever he is, is angling to become Pope himself.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: How can I serve you in this?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Perhaps you can find out who this secret leader of the Jesuits is. You are now a priest, but you were once a Musketeer, serving the throne of France, a throne ordained of God. Can you accept this mission, and keep it private?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: If I find out the identity of this Jesuit rebel.  I will kill both him and the man who told me.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Once a Musketeer, always a Musketeer, eh?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Your Majesty...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: How goes that favor I asked of you?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I grow closer to my target, your Majesty.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You bring me the heart of the Jesuit General, and you will have a palace of your own.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Wh-- Wha--

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Don't look so shocked, Phillippe. Come, you're going back to prison.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Phillippe?!  Why do you call me --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: D'Artagnan, arrest them all!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Shut up, knave!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: And some problems cannot be settled without one.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Well here is the problem at hand: the King has ordered me to discover the identity of the Governor General of Jesuits, and kill him.  As our English rivals have left the Catholic Church, Louis has struck on a plan to dominate the whole of Europe by uniting Church and State and making himself head of both.  He has already picked the Pope.  Only the Jesuits, who put God above throne or papacy, stand in his way.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: What do you propose to do?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Replace the king.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: It can.  I know the way.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: I am with you!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: What are they doing?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Making the key to the throne.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Porthos sleeps, and you plot.  Don't you think it's time you told me what it is you are plotting?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Soon enough.  Here we are.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: The Prison of Belle Sur.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Come, we have a boat waiting.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: A body.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: I see that is a body!  But where did you get it?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Prison was horrible but it was his home.  He's been torn from it by strangers.  He's frightened, exhausted -- and the mask is familiar.  Let him rest in it tonight, and remove it tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Excellent, Athos.  You have a keen sense of this man.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: His plight is obvious, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Who is he, Aramis?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Tonight!  Right now!  We steal a man from a royal prison, we hide in a country chateau among an assortment of saints and sluts such as only you could provide, and still you wish to tell me nothing?!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: You seek facts, when it would be better to seek truth.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: You are not my priest, Aramis!  You would not be, even if I had one.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: You are bitter, Athos.  You are torn by grief, not only for Raoul, but for d'Artagnan, whom you love, and now treat as an enemy.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: He who is not with us is against us.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Those are the words of a broken spirit.  My spirit is whole.  I have trusted d'Artagnan with my deepest secrets, and I will never believe he is my enemy.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Then you are a fool -- a fool who has never lost a son.  What gives you the right to judge me, to play God with the lives of others?  Is it because you are so much holier than everyone else?!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: There is that, of course -- but mainly it is because I am so much smarter than everyone else.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Switch?!  That is your plan?  It is ludicrous!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I have it all worked out.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Physical resemblance is but one small thing!  Louis has an arrogance, a manner --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Those can be adopted --

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: And people close to him, who --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Do you think I have not considered that?  I have a plan -- and you may rest assured that it is brilliant!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: It is not just our lives you risk with this conceit of yours!  It is Phillippe's as well!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Yes, and he has a choice!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: How is he?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Resting, he's had a long day. Aramis --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: More wine!!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: You must reconsider this plan. Phillippe is like a child, he --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: You can do it.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: In a year, maybe two, I could teach him enough to --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Three days.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Three days??!!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: The King is having a ball, a masquerade ball.  It is the perfect opportunity and perhaps our only one.  At any time Phillippe could be discovered, and what then?  Remember France.  Remember the poor. Remember Raoul.  More wine!!  Where are those serving girls...?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Phillippe -- he's very bright, he's perceptive, but he is in such turmoil --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: You grow fond of him.  That's good.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Don't play God with me, Aramis I --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Go on.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: But -- what is Porthos doing?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Going into the barn naked -- or so it appears.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Now.  You were saying?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: But -- what is he doing?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: About to hang himself, I should think.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Hang himself?!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: He's threatened to do it, it's been building up in him for months.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: We must stop him!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Come now, Athos, if Porthos is determined to end his life, then he will certainly manage to find the opportunity.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: But -- but --

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Poor Phillippe!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: The mask is terrifying... especially when unexpected.  Do you notice?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: All I noticed was that Phillippe feels even more like an animal.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Where are you going?!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Paris.  There is still much to do. We'll be back soon.  Be ready.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: But Aramis -- !  Phillippe can learn in time, but --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: He can learn to be Phillippe in time.  But first he must learn to be Louis, and for that he has two more days.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: What you're asking is impossible!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I offer you the perfect revolution. A revolution without bloodshed, without any loss of life, even without treason, for he too is the son of the King.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: You said you'd do anything, Athos, anything to replace this King.  So do it.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Aramis, this will never --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Louis is planning a visit to the Vatican, then who knows where after that.  If we miss him now we may not get another chance.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: It presses us but it is good for us too!  Louis' whims make him more vulnerable.  We are less ready, but so are his guards!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Remember, Phillippe... nobility is born in the heart.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Hold your goblet with two fingers.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Bloody hell...

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: We can't... stay here.  That traitor d'Artagnan... knows about this place.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: He seeks redemption.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: You're a fool!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Perhaps.  But of d'Artagnan I am certain.  What he did tonight was what he told us all along he would do -- be faithful to his King.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: So what has changed?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Perhaps he serves a different king.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Then to the Bastille.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: To the Bastille.  And death.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: A simple theological discussion.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Aramis -- the King wishes to see you.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Still you serve him loyally -- though people hurl rotten eggs at his royal emblem.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Look at us.  We are old men now.  But once we were young.  And when we saw injustice, we fought it.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: We have grown wiser with age.  Now we know that some problems cannot be settled with a sword.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: No!  Stop --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I will need you all.  All for one. One for all.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: You -- You cannot ask me to betray my king!  I have sworn to him!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I have heard many confessions, d'Artagnan.  But even if I were not a priest, I could tell your heart has a secret weight, and it is hurting you to carry it alone.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: The secret I carry I cannot share. Not even with God.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I cannot betray Louis.  I will defend him with my life.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I know.  God go with you.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Pull them back, d'Artagnan.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: You can't do it.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Pull them back!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Everyone back.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Phillippe, get into the boat.  Into the boat!  Now!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Once you are through, don't stop until you reach the river.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: They will know you helped us, if we go this way.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: That doesn't matter now.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: D'Artagnan... Those are young Musketeers down there.  They have been weaned on our legends.  They revere us -- it is an advantage. Why don't we charge them?

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I trained those men myself.  They will stand and fight.  But if we are to die, let it be this way.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Please revel with me, Aramis, I need my spirits lifted.  I'm old, I'm weak, my strength is gone --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Be quiet, you fat fool.  Can't you see I'm praying?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: I just said you're praying!  Are you deaf too?  I know you're blind, because if you had seen the tits that just walked out of here, you'd have tears in your eyes.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: There are more important things than tits.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Really?  If you can name me one thing, one single thing, that is more sublime than the feel of a plump pink nipple between my lips, I will buy you a new cathedral.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Forgiveness.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Forgiveness?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: I observe your forgiveness isn't sweeter than a plump nipple.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Can't you see I'm praying, goddammit?!

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Aramis... is this the way to hell?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Hell may be our destination, dear Porthos, but not this trip.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Jesus of Nazareth found the holy among the profane.  If we are to have a place of private prayer, where better than here, beside the channels where the shit and the garbage run to the river?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Mother of God!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: It is also a place of burial.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: A tomb?  We're in a tomb?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Catacombs.  Very holy.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: But -- doesn't God ordain both Pope and King?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: So they tell us.  But what are we to believe when the king is a tyrant, and the Church, meant to stand for all those oppressed, has become the tool of oppression?  When no conscience is tolerated?  No dissent, no objection?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: It is a weighty problem, Aramis -- but perhaps you should leave it to this secret General of the Jesuits, whoever he might be.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Easy to say, but hard to do.  For what I am trying to tell you is that I am the Governor General of Jesuits in France.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: And why are you so glum?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: I expected action.  There was no killing, no fighting, I was useless.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Aramis!  Athos!  He looks exactly like... exactly like...

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I will answer all your questions. But first soap, water, and a razor.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: The greatest secret of life is who we truly are.  Now I must give you that secret, which has been kept from you your whole life.  It began on the night when Louis was born.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: I remember that night.  D'Artagnan was drunk, the only time I've seen him that way.  The three of us were reveling, remember, Athos?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: But I was on duty...

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: I don't understand.  What does this have to do with...?  You carried a baby somewhere, it's unusual, but --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Not just a baby, Porthos.  I carried the child of the king.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: The child of the king is... the king.  Louis!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: No, not Louis!

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Athos, do you understand this?  He confuses me --

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: I carried the king's child!  The queen had twins that night, and one of them was sent away, in secret!

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: But why?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Because the old king had a twin as well, and through his whole reign his brother fought him for the throne.  Then he had two heirs, not just sons but twins.  So he decided that one be put away, as if he never existed.  You, Phillippe.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: You've been moping for months.  Now that you've gotten the idea of killing yourself out of the way, you can stop boring me and start being useful to me.  Now get some rest.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Well... Well... Okay.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Coming?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: What use am I?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: We go someplace dangerous.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Why didn't you say so?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Let's see you rob somebody with your pistol there!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Come on...

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Aramis... These are... these are whores!

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: So was Mary Magdalene, and our Lord loved her.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Did she have tits like that?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: He's going to kill you, Aramis.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Then let him kill me, if all my faith is wrong.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: But what if something extraordinary happened?  Something so unusual that all the attention went to someone else?  Someone whose confirmation of Phillippe the King would never be questioned.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: The Queen Mother.  Anne.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: D'Artagnan watches everything.  We have to be lucky.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: We will make our own luck tonight... if Phillippe holds up.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Can we eat... before we go?  This excitement's given me an appetite.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: Bread and wine... in that cupboard.

turns.speaker: ARAMIS
turns.text: D'Artagnan.  Perhaps you should accept his offer, for we are dead anyway.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: He is right, d'Artagnan.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: He gets one day of confession each year.  Today is the day.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Who does?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: Best not to ask.  Shouldn't even talk about it.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: What do we do now?

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: I don't know about you, but I plan to wait here.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: D'Artagnan, unready?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: At a ball, everyone watches the King!

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: "Phillippe has been removed to the Bastille, to the lower dungeon.  At midnight tonight I will order the guard changed, and will delay the replacements for ten minutes.  That should give you ample time.  Never have I needed more to say:  One for all, and all for one.  D'Artagnan."

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: He lures us to capture.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: What choice is there?  If Phillippe is in the Bastille, then to the Bastille we will go.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: You are right.  But it is a trap.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: So what?  I'd rather die covered in blood, than an old man, lying in my own piss.

turns.speaker: PORTHOS
turns.text: It worked!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: It's a prison, you idiot!  They don't expect anyone to try getting in!  The problem will come when we want out!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Do I look all right?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: None of the ladies will be able to take their eyes off you.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: I care only about Michelle.  Should I ask her when we first arrive? Or... or when we're leaving?  I could ask her in the carriage -- but it is more romantic at the palace. I get so confused...

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Perhaps this will help.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Mother's ring.  I can't take this.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: She died giving you to me.  And I want to die knowing it is one the finger of the women my son loves.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: That must be Raoul!  Raoul!  Look, d'Artagnan's come to visit...! What's wrong?  You look awful!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Michelle, she -- The king has invited her to come live in the palace.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: But -- are you sure?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: We were at her door.  I was just taking the ring from my pocket, for the third time today, when a young Musketeer brought the invitation for her to become a lady-in-waiting for the Queen Mother.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Michelle cannot possibly accept!

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: She cannot possibly refuse.  Her family is poor, they have even less money than we do.  And along with the invitation, the King sent the diamond pendant, from the piglet.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Piglet -- ?  What are you -- ?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Never mind, Papa, it doesn't matter now.  She loved me once.  I want to die remembering that.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Die?  What...?

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: I have rejoined the army, and asked to resume my commission at the head of the troops of General Fromberge.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Fromberge...?!  At the front?!  No.

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: It is already done.  I have just stopped at Mother's grave, to say goodbye, before coming to tell you.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Raoul, no... You cannot do this.  No matter how your heart is broken --

turns.speaker: RAOUL
turns.text: Goodbye, father.  I am sorry.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Raoul --

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: D'Artagnan!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Athos, my friend!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: It's been too long.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Life is too long.  Except when we have our friends.  Look at you! You're still a boy!  Sit, sit!  I'll open a bottle of wine.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Thanks, but not for me.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: You can't drink with a friend you haven't seen in months?

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I have ordered a drill of the Royal Guard for midnight, and must be clear-headed for it.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Midnight!  Mon dieu!  Driving the youngsters hard, eh?

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: They must stay sharp.  There was an attempt on the King's life today.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Another?  How many times have you saved his life in this year alone? Three?  Four?

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I heard your playing.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: I was feeling sorry for myself. Raoul is getting married, he proposed today!  I love that boy beyond all measure, I've spent everything I own to give him education and opportunity.  Now he has complete happiness, and I mope.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: This cannot be.  Everyone knows the Queen Mother is a recluse, and the ladies-in-waiting are but mistresses for the king!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: If the young woman truly loves Raoul --

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: She's a woman, d'Artagnan!  From a poor family.  You may still be young enough to believe love conquers everything, but I am old and hard and I've seen too much.  Even when kings are hunchbacks they have any woman they desire, because power seduces even more than love!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: You knew this was happening.  You knew and that's why you came.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I fear I know our King.  I came to try to bring you hope.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: What hope is there?  A wartime commission cannot be vacated except by the king, and what chance is there of that?  Fromberge is on the battle line, and Raoul --

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I have dispatches a message to Fromberge requesting that Raoul be kept far from the fighting.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Raoul is everything to me.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Oh my friend.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I will also speak with the King, for he is surely unaware of the problems his invitation to Mademoiselle Beaufort has caused.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: You trust his character more than anyone else does.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Raoul is hurrying to the front, so I must hurry too.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Save my son, d'Artagnan.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Athos, please...!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Get out of my way.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Athos, I beg you --

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: To kill the king.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Athos!  I know life means nothing to you at this moment, but I will not let you kill yourself.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: The King killed my son!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: The cannons killed Raoul!  The cannons, and love.  But not the King.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: It is honor you serve, and when the king is dishonorable you are removed from your oath of honor!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: An oath is an oath precisely because it cannot be removed!

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Why do you follow him, d'Artagnan?! I know you have put service above your own life, but why does this King deserve such loyalty?  He is a monster!  He executes ministers for his own blunders, with their families hostage so they take the blame!  He has no honor!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: No man is all bad... or all good.  I believe -- I must believe -- that Louis can learn.  And perhaps I can help him.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: If you ever loved me -- if you ever loved honor, or anything else -- then stand now, and let it happen.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I cannot, Athos.  Dearly as I love you, I cannot.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: He lies.  He is here to trap us.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I came to see you safely out.  Check for yourself.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Recent hours have been a shock.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: Perhaps not as much as you might imagine.  When tutors answered every question except those about who I was.  When I was imprisoned in a way no other man had ever been, I knew there was something different about me.  But a king...

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Phillippe... there is something I hope you understand.  Terrible cruelty has been used against you. And... you must understand that you did nothing to deserve it.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: There is... wrath... in me.  I have learned to hide it.  Those years in the cell, I dreamed that freedom would someday just happen, the way the mask happened.  Now I am free. And with each free breath I feel the growing desire to make someone suffer for all I lost.  Look at this, all this that for ten years I could not see!  What if I become a king -- a king no different from my brother?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: The desire for vengeance... can be a poison.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: What is its antidote?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: I suppose... it is to remember there are many people who have never been in a prison, who pass such beauty every day, and never see it.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: You look so sad.  Is it something I have done?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: It is something I have done -- or did not do.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: I did not share beauty with someone... who is no longer here for me to share beauty with.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: I've worn this mask so long, I couldn't sleep without it.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: I will sit with you.  I can't sleep either.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: I am so sorry!  Forgive me, I --

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: No!  Do not be sorry!  Never be sorry!  The King cares for nothing and for no one!  There are no mistakes when you are King!  What you do is right for every person!  A King has contempt for everyone!

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: Is that the king of king you wish me to be?  Or do you say this because of your son?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: How did you know -- ?

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: Porthos told me.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: These rooms are yours.  Up these stairs -- or through this hidden passage -- is the room of your mistress... Michelle.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: Whose rooms are those?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Your mother's.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: The room of the King's favorite mistress?

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: She will be at the ball.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Phillippe...?

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: How did you --

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: One for all.  All for one.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: If I could have a blade, then I would be please to run with you.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: All this time... I was a lost secret.  But you were hiding all your loyalty, all your love.  You were the Man in the Iron Mask.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: D'Artagnan...

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Are you hungry?

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: Just... water.

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: This place... I once lived in a country house.  I had guardians -- an old man and woman.  And tutors. But no friends.  Then when I was twelve, they came and took me to the prison.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Who came?

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: A man in black.  I never saw his face.  He took me to the cell.  A blacksmith came and they put me into the mask.  For days I shouted, "What have I done?  Why do you do this to me?"  But no one heard, so I just stopped shouting.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: And you never knew why?

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: The old man and woman called me... Phillippe.

turns.speaker: ATHOS
turns.text: Phillippe.  Rest now.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Your Majesty...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What is it, d'Artagnan?  Assassins falling from the sky now?
